author: Slidebean
description:
Neuralink’s next milestone: upgrading an active brain implant.

Neuralink reports that its first human subject now relies on his brain computer interface for hours each day, using it continuously for gaming and learning.

The company is now considering an in place upgrade, not for repair, but for expanded functionality and finer control.

This marks a critical transition from experimental validation to product evolution.

The question is no longer whether brain computer interfaces work, but how quickly and safely they can improve once embedded in the human nervous system.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: Neuralink wants to upgrade a brain chip while it’s still in someone’s head.
